Decent hack-and-slash game. There's a bit of a story thrown in and some small characterization for the characters that you choose to play. The pixel graphics seem detailed and look great, especially on spell and attack visual effects. Gameplay has the perfect mix of challenging, varied and engaging. It's a no-nonsense offline singleplayer game. However, the lack of support ruins this otherwise perfect dungeon crawler on mobile. This game is FAR outdated compared to its PC port. Lots of features are missing, and the dev seems to not be interested in doing anything about that anymore. Gameplay and classes here feel inferior compared to the updated versions. There seems to be NO CLOUD-SAVES as well, which is a huge bummer for a singleplayer game. That being said, I really can't recommend getting a game that's dead now and lacks cloud saving support, unless you're sticking to a single phone your whole life then yes, this is most definitely worth the buy. Its a good game on its own, but all in all it feels like a project thrown out of the window and left for dead all in favor in updating its PC version (which is dead now as well).

10/10. Honestly. This is, BY FAR, the best game I've played on android.   The controls are even more tight and responsive than they already were in its predecessor, Mage Gauntlet. Combat is very Dark Souls-esque, forcing you to learn enemy's attack patterns and strike/dodge/block at appropriate times, and punishing the impatient and reckless player.   The soundtrack is a masterpiece, coating the game in a thick layer of atmosphere I didn't know was possible for a mobile game. This is further bolstered by the little pieces of story you can encounter in the procedurally generated levels, which also serve to make them feel not as such. Each character also has their own unique and interesting backstory that is told piece by piece as you progress through the dungeons.   The replay value is endless. Collecting hats is extremely satisfying, and the roster of 6 characters each has their own persistent skills/perks that can be upgraded in-between playthroughs to give a sense of progression alongside the permadeath aspect.   The graphics and spritework are masterfully done, further adding to the atmosphere and making each level and environment a joy to navigate through, with things like destructible furniture/objects and various physics techniques.  I can confidently say that this game is worth every penny I paid for it and more, and definitely holds the title of #1 android game right now. Do yourself a huge favour and add this one to your collection.

This is an awesome game. For those trying to get the Moga Hero or Power Pro to work, install Moga Pivot and Moga VK. Pair your controller with Pivot in Mode A (the switch on the controller). Hit the cog/gear in the top right for setting, add application, select Wayward Souls, save profile. Launch Wayward Souls. X is attack, Y is swipe up, A is swipe down.
